qCk8sUQvi01gwBB-ilk0zA.text: You won't find a better local non-corporation owned bar in Charlotte with better food. Try the whole menu. I've had most things menu items here but the wings in any flavor and the burgers are legit! Located in a great comfy neighborhood and I really like the layout here for sports.

naniT5e_9QAjQKp4PEWUrg.text: Okay, so it has taken me forever to get out to this place but finally made it a few days ago. It's strange that others have some terrible reviews of this place and from what I hear around town a lot of people certainly don't speak as highly about their experiences here compared to mine.   We were here on a Wednesday which is apparently one of TWO weekly trivia events held here. The crowd was pretty large but everyone had a table and it didn't seem overcrowded. It's actually worth mentioning that we never once felt we were neglected by our server. In fact, our server offered some of the better service I've experienced in quite some time. We were always asked if we needed an another beer at the perfect time and checked on just enough times without being annoying.  The food here exceeded our expectations by quite a bit. I split the Bleu Cheese Burger and an order of chicken tenders tossed in their hottest hot sauce. As far as I'm concerned they nailed both of these orders. Apparently the burgers are all made in-house (not frozen patties from a distributor) and it certainly made a difference. Flavor of the burger and the addition of the blue cheese was great. The tenders were great as well and I don't think I'd ever recommend tenders without tossing them in some type of sauce.  As for the atmosphere, which I've heard many complain specifically about, I personally saw no problem and actually had a good experience here. It wasn't super dark like many bars of the same caliber in town, the service was great, the food was good and it wasn't super loud at any point. I'll need to pop in here on a weekend to see if the vibe is any different as I'd expect it to be vs. a Wednesday but in general very pleased with this place for a bite to eat and a few beer.  Oh! And it's worth mentioning that it looks like they have some pretty great deals on beer as well as a pretty good selection. Monday's are 1/2 of Drafts AND the same goes for Tuesdays.

waVP3LZ924Y0Qx2tCtgLPQ.text: Best place for Sunday football in charlotte. I love the atmosphere here and they have $2 beers. The food here is really lacking compared to other bars and the vibes of this place makes up for it. Overall I love this place during NFL season.

W4nXSc82V67EuxmE3NxuAQ.text: I have been coming to this building since before it was called Eds Tavern back in early 2000's.  Sat at the bar the other night.  The beers, burger, wings, and fried mushrooms are all great.  The menu prices are great and keep me coming back.  The bartenders are attentive and friendly.  5 stars

PVs4ldHcP3iaVgKXqbZxVw.text: Great service, good drink specials and lots of TV's to watch games great food get "a basket of Bacon" (maple/ honey) or the southwest egg rolls!! Yum

cLYRtSP6-yzK-OXHa_-XZQ.text: Great bar and atmosphere. Food is good, what you would expect from a charlotte staple. Definitely recommend.

ey3oiKfl54oGQEWGFImMEg.text: Stumbled into this local spot by chance mid-afternoon Saturday, and will certainly return on purpose, even though we do not live nearby.  Fun, local sports bar - a real one - not the typical "franchise / chain" wannabe manufactured digs or phoney atmosphere.  For you sports fans, TV's are everywhere.  For you beer fans, I counted 31 tap handles.  If your nickname is "Minnesota", they also have pool tables!  Food was particularly good at mid-afternoon - a good sign that their kitchen stood ready during an off-hour.  Wife had a very generous portion of pulled pork - nothing really special - but it was good quality and nicely presented. Portion was plenty to eat there plus some to take home!  Fish-and-chips for me, and it was GREAT!  Had it many times in British pubs, and Ed's version was quite authentic - other than it was served on a plate vs. newspaper.  An observation - not a criticism - I will eagerly order it again next time.  My generous portion of fish was fresh, too hot to eat when served, (a very good thing) and perfectly battered and fried. Chips were also too hot to handle and perfectly crispy.  Burgers at next table also looked tempting.  My spicy - don't be shy - Bloody Mary(s) had a perfect kick!  Waitress was perky and appropriately attentive.  Mixed and comfortable crowd mostly 20/30s mixed with a few of us in the card-carrying Medicare vintage.  Crowd was enjoying the place - nobody seemed out of place regardless of age.  We originally thought the place was empty since parking is in the rear.  We will return, and I suggest you try it!

ypUnxYZJo8dBwOgGgCr-ag.text: This is you're typical neighborhood bar with pretty good appetizers and sandwiches. It can get a little loud on some nights, so if you're looking for a quiet dinner/drink spot, you may wanna try elsewhere. The service was so-so, but it was pretty busy, so that's understandable. Prices in general and the draft beer selection are pretty average. This is a convenient, last minute kind of place to take friends for food and drinks.

jaO_WZewC8jqFrhJxZ7BUw.text: We went with a large group for music trivia on a Wednesday.  The trivia was fun, but in the last round, certainly tilts more towards newer music.  Not entirely, but I would suggest taking a 21 year old who loves rap and Katy Perry to pull out the win!  We didn't eat, but drank our weight in booze.  A good, not great, draft beer selection.   Would I return for more trivia? Yes. Do I wish the volume level of ambient noise was about 10% of what it was that night?  Definitely!  I mean, I enjoy yelling to  my girlfriend who's sitting 18 inches away from me, but not all night.    Overall, I'd go back, but not without earplugs during trivia.

yMwkfW3jU0s_Z96rPAw_Pg.text: I give up...this place used to be great , the food was always good and we loved the laid back atmosphere but I am officially NEVER eating here again , the food quality has nosedived. I implore you do not waste your money on the wings they are terrible . rubbery, almost undercooked with NO SAUCE ( and this has happened more than once ) if you want real chicken wings try leboswskis they are CONSISTENTLY excellent ..crisp, meaty and saucy. AND they are right around the corner ! And no I don't work there or own it.

gfzYbeQBasWH3QCpB6X3LQ.text: Horrible service with even worse food! Stopped by this past weekend and was asking the server about a drink on special. She told me she had no idea because she was underage. We ordered an appetizer of tachos- they came out with hard cold queso cheese on them. 2KvIsvNrnKPek_4h8dZHHQ.text: I went on a Saturday with a friend at about 6pm, prime dinner hour. It seemed pretty slow though it started to pick up around 7:30 as we were leaving. It was close to 100 degrees in Charlotte today so the new back patio was close to empty. I expect the deck to get busier in the evenings with cooler temps. She got the chicken tender plate, I did the mushroom Swiss burger with fries. Most entrees will run in the $9.50 - $13.00 range. I typical don't take the easy way out on reviews but everything about my visit was "average". No complaints on the staff, beer selection, parking, prices, etc. - The real draw for this place would be if there was a sporting event on you'd want to watch. Some of the best TV's for game watching near South End.

6wFw_RfH-epMp9yrwHll9g.text: Eds is a solid place to go to eat and drink. I went for trivia night and it was a total blast. Great drink specials and the quesadillas are bomb. The service is kind of slow though. I will be back to Eds again for trivia and the awesome quesadillas!

GM-xaOtjGLbsBb1EpesAIg.text: So  so. Not the same eds. Need Improvement.  Service great. Atmosphere good. Food lacking.

ka-3gujXbtSJu8wl8uKSMQ.text: This place is pretty descent.   The best night of the week is Wednesday Night when they have music trivia from 9pm-11pm. You can have as many people on your team that you want, cell phones are not permitted, and there is always a theme! There is 3-rounds of challenging songs for you to guess the title and artist: first round is pretty easy, second gets more challenging, and the third is when you send up one person from your team to face off at who's the quickest to say the correct artist out loud! The host is great and I love that no matter what creative team name you come up with he must say it! And trust me people get creative.  Team Names I've Heard Used Here:  My Grandma can't fight, but you should see her box I like my President like I like my coffee Drinks Are On the House Tonight My Couch Pulls Out But I Don't I wish this microphone was a dick Titanic Swim Team I didn't slap you, I just high-fived your face I Twittered All Over Her Facebook I like my president like I like my coffee I'm not gay, but 5 bucks is 5 bucks  *Best Tip for this place: They have a Banana Beer on Draft, You're welcome.

QMNvuHlJCiZNpSYfYuhnMg.text: Went here on Thursday for trivia night. This place has a laid back vibe and was pretty crowded on trivia night. I only tried the hummus plate but it was not bad. All the food looked like good bar food. They have a lot of local beers as well as specials, friendly service too.  Part of an episode of Homeland was also filmed here too so that was pretty neat!  update: have been multiple times since and have tried many of their appetizers and i have not been disappointed. if friend pickles are your thing you should get some here

AMp_yR22fh2E5tv94vI25Q.text: Love Eds.  Great vibe, above average food and DECENT beer specials.  The Ed's Amber is always a steal at $2.  Come for trivia Wednesday or Thursday.    The only bad thing is the lack of consistency of the wait staff.  80% of the time theyre great.  The other 20% you never see your waitress.  Bottom Line, Go to Eds (Had to give $$ cause you dont go to Eds and not drink)

fqimt59wmo2C7Tu9ShIhPA.text: ED'S TAVERN...... = CHEER'S  i go enough and taken enough friends where they call me the Mayor! I'm more of a "shot" taker than a Drink Drinker. 72A5PIWU9qRER8BgnVi6Kw.text: Good food, good prices, sports bar vibe. Everything we got was solid. Service was friendly. The food came out a little slow, but not too bad. Good neighborhood restaurant.

KLAKEr7KE3plViw2AGRSSA.text: Great neighborhood bar! Definitely nothing fancy, but a great dive bar. I'm not sure Id eat here, but they have great local beers and a decent liquor section. I look forward to the new patio!

ES7LKZgEL07524Rw41Wkzw.text: When I used to live in Southend, I LOVED Ed's. I would go there at least once a week. The games, the crowd, the food, and the staff all made the place so awesome! It pains me to write this review, but with the staffing changed I feel I have to tell Yelpers about my awful experience. I went with a group of 10 people just to have some drinks this past Friday. The specials were $5 well drinks (again, thank you Ed's), and I was having a hard core love fest with the Tatchos. My issue came when I got the bill. By accident, the bartender had put my friend's drinks on my bill. Usually no issue. However, another bartender had already charged them for their drinks and this bartender was refusing to change it. Heather, the bartender, introduced herself, and instead of thinking there was a mistake, she patronized me in front of my friends and said "honey you didn't drink just two drinks, you had four and a beer". For one, I had two drinks because I was the DD of the night. If you want to tell me I inhaled all of the tatchos, GUILTY as charged, but don't tell me I had more to drink than I already did. I explained to her that my bill should only be $18 instead of $50+ and she again patronized me and said "Honey (again, what is with that word?!), I AM sober. You had more to drink". My fiance and friends all saw my drinks, and although they tried to vouch, Heather wasn't having it. I was starting to feel crazy. I don't care if I drank the drinks, but if the exact drinks I'm over is the exact beer/cocktails that are on another tab, don't you think it might be best to at least investigate with the other bartenders and not make a customer feel lower than dirt? She made me feel like I was losing it, embarrassed me in front of my friends by the way she talked to me, and was overall a poor customer experience. I've never been treated so poorly! I asked to speak to a manager and she told me that it was too late and she already ran my card, to please sign because she was too busy to "handle this situation". Ed's, you have truly broke my heart. If it wasn't for your Tatchos, I would have given you one star, but that's not fair. Your staffing has changed for the worst and although Heather the bartender offered to give me "Several drinks" next time I came in, I doubt she would a) remember me or b) hold up a promise. Sigh.

4ezuRpL4TsouFxv3vjCV3g.text: Food and beer is great.  However they have a giant patio in the back.  It's 10:15pm on a beautiful Saturday night.  Management just asked everyone outside to go inside.  Total fail.  What's the point of the patio?

HubaeI35W3cNJFB3c_cH5A.text: I really enjoyed my meal at Ed's.  It was the first time I've eaten there.  I had the Southwestern Egg Rolls and they were so delicious.  I'm still thinking about them and that doesn't happen very often with me.  I love good food so I try a lot of different things.  I was there on an evening when the Panthers were playing in uptown Charlotte so the place was packed but the service was still good and the food came out fast. I will definitely be back to Ed's.

gZ6kBO8E04_mADH7L2-jYQ.text: Can you please get a blender or take it off the menu. Came here just for a frozen margarita and they said they don't have a blender and have no plans on getting a new one.

LUORGBCpjEMV2xM6f_izwA.text: good service, very nice update esp with patio. wings are great, esp Bourbon sauce. buffalo wings were a bit too tough and salty for me, but hey, that's just me.  house salad was a good quality,  I like lots of greens so it could be a touch more greens on the dish for 7 bucks.... all in all, I like it, inside and out.

VdtKIAbUz6XwEn8eoWQUyA.text: So I came here last night with my boyfriend and the entire the staff of the restaurant he works at for an after holiday party drink. We had joined everyone at ten park lanes on Montford after he got off work but as they were wrapping everything up since they were closing we decided to go with everyone to Eds so that he could enjoy a little time with his coworkers and not to mention also provide a little help transporting people since everyone else had already been there and were already pretty drunk.   Well we walk in and order a round of drinks (only our 2nd drinks of the evening btw) and I told my guy I would be right back I had to use the restroom I'm just getting over this nasty cold that seems to have everyone and their mother sick so I'm in the bathroom blowing my nose for probably the 7000th time and when I walk out of the bathroom I'm greeted by a woman who was either a bartender or a manager doesn't matter and another staff member AS WELL as a bouncer! The woman standing in front asks me if I'm ok can she get me any help of any kind I'm like no I already ordered my drinks I'm fine thank you??? Really confused but oh well. She then tells me they heard me getting sick and had to make sure I was alright! Ok thats intrusive but nope not getting sick I was blowing my nose can't see how those things sound similar but ok. I walk away from them to join the party and I watch her go behind the bar and tell the bartenders to cut me off! I then turn around to see the bouncer who has decided to tell my boyfriend he has to leave and is escorting him out the BACK door!!! They told me he was too intoxicated and that he could no longer remain on the property, and I suppose he's also a bag of trash that they needed to take out seeing as how they felt the need to escort him out the back door and not ask him to walk out the front door we walked through 5 mins ago! No no no not happening I grabbed my guys arm and pulled him back in and told them we would be more than happy to walk ourselves out the door WE CAME IN and never walk back in it either.   Ok so first off neither one of us were any where even in the vicinity of being drunk it was also incredibly embarrassing for the staff to make such a scene when they were so in the wrong! Never mind the fact that they clearly wouldn't know a drunk person if they hit them in the face! The group we came in with were definitely drunk! I know I drove them there! But they were provided rounds of shots and beers upon entrance no questions asked! The one and only other time this has happened to us was a similar situation with SIP uptown we took an Uber for our first stop and first drinks of the night again told we couldn't drink somewhere because we seemed drunk already but at least SIP had the balls to make it abundantly clear it was about appearance and didn't wait for us to spend any money in their establishment first.   And now after reading over a few of the other reviews of this place it's clear this isn't their first offense and probably won't be their last. But to be clear the staff is rude and unprofessional and I highly highly suggest you take your hard earned money elsewhere to a different bar or restaurant that will treat you with respect and not judge you/embarrass you or try to take you out the back like a bag of trash. Shame on your staffs behavior Eds tavern but thank you for showing your True colors so that neither myself nor any of my other close friends ever spends a minute of our time or money with you.
