Z-B0x7rwpmRR1S6Yt6kAog.text: Okay 4 stars for the bar and atmosphere, 3.75 stars for the food (the food is good bar food not "great" bar food, how do you rate that?;)  First you need to understand that this bar is tucked neatly on the edge of Dilworth, and is very walkable from many of the surrounding homes, thus making it an easy choice for anyone who needs late night grub and or comradery (read people mingle here).  They are open late which is a plus, they have pool tables also a plus, if you like to pick your own music they have a touch tunes device there.  Decent beer selection on tap, if you're a beer snob go somewhere else.  If you like your beer served in buckets maybe this is 4.5 stars for you.  All in all Ed's is fun and the location is great, I expect their new patio will be very popular in the warmer months.

Ezo4rWj2U3vACk62E1uQ6g.text: Mixed reviews for the Party on the Patio experience. Amazing atmosphere to enjoy the weather. They should have moved the cornhole down to parking area to make room for more tables. We waited around for a table and finally snagged one but a server never came by. Finally a server came by but only to pick up the check from the table before us and was more than ready to walk off without even acknowledging us. I stopped her and asked if she was our server and she finally sent over our sever. Service from there on out was better. The $5 bloody Mary's were really good, better than the average Bloody Mary special. They offer a lot of drafts betters too! The patio is big and nice but over all there is definitely room for important!

L7KX6mmIW5ZEt3E4BuWEqw.text: Gave trivia night another shot at Ed's... I think last time the trivia was a bit hard and it was hard to not notice the scores of people looking up answers on their smart phones.  Luckily the phone policy has been "reinforced" or it seemed like it was.  Trivia should be better if you actually know the answers!  Not how well you can use your smart phone.  Anyways - I got there early and ate at the bar waiting for my friends to show up.  The barkeeps were nice and also let me change a tv to watch a different sport than they had up there.  They have a ton of tvs so it's hard to miss any sort of sports action going on.  Had the fish tacos, which were nice... I liked that the tacos were "pre-limed" so it had a good citrus kick to it (without having to get your fingers all limey).  Maybe it's just the laziness in me, but I appreciate when the chef/cook/kitchen says, "this is what you are eating... you have no options"  I think there is a boldness about it.  From there it can go either two ways - you absolutely hate what was given to you, or bask in it's greatness.  My side was the cucumber salad... which I didn't care for.... sliced cucumbers with paprika and vinegar... was a bit soggy and sad.  I did eat it all (begrudgingly) .  Trivia was fun and we even won a round of beers!  Definitely will return.

--VyrUXzY1-Adjc2wmaW7Q.text: WOW! This place was exceptional, not only because every meal we enjoyed had a variety of options and was flavorful but also because the prices were so reasonable! I would definitely recommend Shae as your waitress. She is AWESOME! You can definitely expect a good time and great service. Sometimes, to my delight, the experience exceeds my expectations! I highly recommend anyone paying Eds a visit!

t-YEpJrWevBUBDNxN2FvsA.text: Mmmm wings! Didn't feel like burning my lips off so I stayed clear of the Chuck Norris wings but did have me some delicious hot wings.

gY5q7zloHceE2Vvkt4z0Hw.text: Great place for drinks and fun! They have a nice patio out back and seating outfront, large on the inside. They have *excellent* drink specials and a good amount of TVs to watch the games. They have pool, corn hole, skee ball, basketball and a few other games, also have a checkers bar so you can sit drink and play. Their food is decent, I usually stick to burgers/wings.

BJtYYFgeKyhljh4sSbPXeQ.text: The fact that I'm here (average) twice a week might have more to do with proximity than affection, but if this place weren't awesome, I'd go elsewhere.  Great selection of draft beers (including the wonderful 1.75 coors light).  The bar food is good.  I'm partial to the App Sampler (especially at half price on Fridays) and definitely the sliders.  Also, if you're planning on taking the Wing Challenge - don't sit near me - kthx.

NJ1RCxWbE6ROsffNnCe5lQ.text: I think Ed's may be one of the only True neighborhood bars in Charlotte. They have very good bar food at a decent price. They also have a good beer list. They are always having some great specials as well. I have been to there trivia a couple times and it is usually packed. The trivia is one of the best around. We really emjoy playing there Sappo game over there. If you have been there before and never seen it, it's in the corner next to the pool tables. Dont be afraid to try it with some friends. It is a really cool bar game. Ed's tends to be steadily busy every night and the servers are always great.

V0qSXADgFUNZUqLtekSmHA.text: Awesome happy hour bar, late night bar and everything in between!  Go Friday nights and they will have a live band (but it is always too loud for this old lady's ears!)  The food here is fantastic, I have had the chicken wrap and it is always a ton of food for not a lot of money.  There are fun arcade-type games in the back and plenty of seating.  They always have really sweet bartenders and servers.  Love this place!!!

pzxIGqU_2VvT9FFbvEk-8A.text: This is a total sports bar.  My boyfriend and I met up with another couple here for drinks, and the place was ridiculously packed.  But after a while, the crowd dispersed a bit and was much more manageable.  At that point, we were easily able to find a table and chill out.  Once at the table, we never had a server come by, so it might be that it's all bar service on the weekend.  They have a few pool tables, which is cool.  Also, you have your typical beer list, making this a good standby for a lowkey night.

Zjjq57I3TDa6k3m-avIy3w.text: All of the other reviews do a really good job covering this place. When a friend recommended it I was not sure what to expect. I came away very impressed.

l_oHWwdEq0mK9myDfrVw6A.text: Ed's is a your typical neighborhood sports bar.   It's packed during football games and other big sporting events. And you'll find what you'd expect on those days - lots of obnoxious drunk guys.  But I recently went there on a sunny Thursday afternoon and had a great time sitting on the back patio. I tried the veggie wrap and the mozzarella sticks for an appetizer. Both were delicious.

czJO7zrF1fUmmVbGsDgFXA.text: This is a great place to get all kinds of bar food, and to make you feel better about eating it, everything here is freshly prepared (they don't use frozen or canned food).  I recommend the burger, chicken caesar wrap, and the chicken fingers basket.  They are open for lunch, dinner, and late-night. The food is great, and they have have decent drink specials (if nothing else Coor's Light draft is always a $1.50).  The only negative I have about this place is that since they are a new restaurant they seem a little overwhelmed.  It can get really crowded, especially on game day, and the service can be really slow.    After living next to Ed's for the last several months, I will add that I think the service has gotten worse, something always seems to be wrong.  Also, because of decent drink prices, there are a lot of douche bags here on thurs-sat nights.  Oh, and if you sit at a table at night, don't go to the bar to order your drinks or the waitres will get pissed!

9a2p734EGDxIDwJPgOjvZw.text: Always a good place to grab a snacka and a cold beer. Last night I took a friend from Oregon to bar and we had the wings. They were great. Meaty cooked just right. They have an interesting flavor "Blackened Parmesan Cheese"... TASTY, just the right amount of spice and cheesy flavor. My wife LOVES the homemade Hungarian Cucumber Salad.  Great selection of beer and the place is just hopping on Thursday nights and through the weekend. Will be back again and again.

acYST3lyNGyz13CQKm947g.text: Ed's Place is cool.  A neighborhood spot definitely, and they have some delicious beer.  I stopped in the other day, mid-October, grabbed a "Kind Beer" a high gravity beer and sat outside at the picnic tables enjoying this tasty brew and the Charlotte Fall weather.  The "Kind Beer" was inexpensive and very kind, with a taste similar to Sierra Nevada, but with much more of a punch.  My friend and I made this our first stop on a little trek I like to call "The Bike Bar Crawl" which basically consists of bars I can ride my beach cruiser to, Ed's Place was stop numero uno. Keep your eyes open for stop 2 and see if you can connect the dots....  P.S. it might be in reverse.

aACXTtJX-9EFWKjwgVbCnw.text: $1.50 Coors Light Pints everyday.  Chicken sandwich with cucumber salad to eat.

mftFVZ4gqkzL2cOsNgx9qQ.text: This is a great place if you're just looking to chill with a group of friends. It get's fairly busy on Wednesday and Thursday nights for trivia from about 9:00 to 11:00. There is a smaller crowd there on Friday and Saturday nights. On Saturday nights they usually have a small band. The food is just above average for bar food.  They have about 10 decent size flat screen TV's but the picture quality isn't that great. They usually don't turn the sound on for games. They have a back deck/patio and a small front patio with cornhole. They have two pool tables, a few video games, and lots of checker boards. The crowd is usually mid 20's to mid 30's.  The best thing about this bar is the $1.75 coors light drafts.

rLLN-aktbhx272IB5lTRFg.text: Normally I have no problems with Ed's Tavern, but the lack of service today was pretty bad. My friend & I sat at the bar around 12:30 & were left high & dry for about eight minutes. Being quite hungry & thirsty, we decided to leave & go somewhere else. I was really looking forward to a bunch of delicious hot wings and vodka drinks at Ed's today, but the staff on hand did not provide those things. I'd really hate to cross Ed's off my list, but if the service is as bad the next time as is was today I certainly will.

yN1rr628xU4hba75262qEg.text: My fiance and I live down the street, and subsequently spend Friday nights and Sunday mornings at Eds. Their brunch is AMAZING and I'd argue its the best in Charlotte. While the brunch menu is quite limited, the eggs are incredible. Naturally I was eavesdropping a few weeks ago and heard the patrons behind me say that Ed's get their eggs from a local farm. You can tell. The full lunch/dinner menu is pretty good as well. My fiance says they have the best wings he's ever had. My only complaint is that we have waited FOREVER on multiple occasions. If you're in a rush, you might want to think twice. We waited over 30 minutes for our brunch last weekend when there were only a handful of tables open. I'm not sure if its a waitress issue or a kitchen issue, but we've started just sitting at the bar with our favorite waitress (tall, skinny, funny brunette)  who always seems to get our food out right and on time. Sit at the bar if you're in a hurry or don't want to deal with a messed up order.

R1JkB2NLN_YBXGzdzd0HFg.text: Ehhhhhhhhhhhhh.  That's about all I can say.  Definitely sports oriented and so damn crowded on the weekends it's not even funny.  We got harrassed by some weird guy on the back patio last time we were there who would not leave us alone.  I think there are better places in Charlotte to hang out especially if you don't live near this place.  A neighborhood fave I'm sure, but not for me.

ZUkrS90X5c_PxHclQU_mnw.text: I feel weird saying it, but I honestly love Ed's. It's an easy and comfortable place to hang out, especially if you go during off-times. I love taking up a booth on a Saturday afternoon and people-watching. Plus, the nachos are some of the best I've had so far in Charlotte. Service is usually pretty good. If you're over 25, just avoid Ed's on Friday nights/big game days - unless you're looking for that kind of thing -  and you'll be happy with your experience.

qlJk354_aB1vma517isb1A.text: I love this spot for solid bar food and beer! It's nestled in Dilworth, but there's ample parking for you and your friends! There's plenty of TV's to catch everyone's favorite team, and there's also a ton of games to keep you occupied. They also have trivia one night during the week, and it gets packed! I can't attest to everything on the menu, but everything that I've had has been tasty. I highly recommended the spinach and artichoke dip, it's creamy and full of artichokes. Their tots are tasty too, and really, who doesn't love tots?

photos.caption: Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spinach and artichoke dip. Had to take a bite before the picture.

3o9-aeTp2oTnD5gi0C3M-w.text: Just a great bar! Good prices on beer and the food isn't too bad either. Service is always quick  Great place to watch a game

ZQhk4Ci9bkY4g55cyz36Cw.text: Ed's Tavern is your typical bar. The highlights of the bar was the live band. Also they have several game areas as well ample TVs to watch any sporting event your heart desires. The food is bar food so don't go expecting something that is going to knock your socks off. The bar was very busy and our waitress seemed a bit overwhelmed. We often had to stop her as she walked past our table to place our order. However, when we did have her attention she was awesome. This place is a good way to spend some time watching the game and drinking beer. Eat before you come though.

oURjWKjv8bIWVKvPU58Xig.text: Customer service is awful! If you want to be completely ignored and disregard, ask for Nick

bidePEWG0ewO5MCKGvaeaA.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch. Had the tomato soup and grilled cheese. Delicious for $6!!! Will definitely go back and try other options!

h05Z77LZ5CuUFO3EVWYtmg.text: Wondering when the blender for frozen drinks will be fixed or ever? I feel like Ed's is one of the few places that has great frozen drinks in the summer but every time we've gone they are unable to make them...

ml6nv4GEZ-6hs7U_Kw3ALA.text: Came here for the 2018 World Cup Final! Great game and a lot of fun...  Got here early. Group of 8 people.  Ordered plenty of drinks but took over 25mins to bring us our 2nd drink because I had to walk to the bar for my first drink....  Ordered food and took a least another hour to bring out some nachos, burger, quesadilla, wings and salad!  Burger was fantastic....BUT my wife ordered sweet potato fries which never came out hours later and 2 conversations with our server.  EDs...WTF happened!  You used to be my go to spot and now I'm embarrassed to even suggest meeting here...congrats on joining the club with peculiar rabbit on my list to "avoid at all cost" establishments in charlotte!

q1usUGIjDstn26G3eyJiUQ.text: This place gives Greece a run for its money for how poorly ran it is and as a Greek...that hits close to home!  I heard Ed's Tavern was a staple for the Dilworth area but instead it's been a staple for lousy service, slow drink orders and average food.  Sad!  This must be the stomping grounds to the Carolina Panthers' offensive line since they have so much in common.  The only thing I can honestly say about this place is that it has a great deck.  Although at times I am hoping I pass out from heat stroke in order to avoid paying for the service I unfortunately received.  Sad!    Also, don't ask to move any tables together, it causes more trouble than it's worth.  Any person would think a server would be happy/open/willing to accommodate a group that had more coming, with the mindset it would led to higher earnings/ tips, wrong.  Instead our group got an ear full as the waitress mouthed off like a teenager at Claire's that doesn't get her way.   Truly shows the type of character they have working here.  I also must note, this is not the first time I've had bad service, it happens every time and I'm sure while you are reading this review on the Light Rail, ask the person next to you if they have experienced the same thing, I'll wait.  Told you so...    Keep the deck and fire the rest, that is the improvement I can give you Ed's Tavern.  Make it a place people from Dilworth are proud of, make it a place of good food, make it a place of good service. Make it great again.

eYZE8h1r74m1u9S31Yf5aw.text: Being from out of town for a weekend we (4 ladies) decided to grab a drink and eat. Walking in there was not a greeting we sat down and looked over the menu asked for options and the waiter had no clue about their own menu, even with the drink selections. We ended up ordering cocktail drinks that seemed to be a simply drink but everyone of our drinks did not taste good at all.

4OtrPvoVNU-P1dTi5QaC7w.text: I would like to start by saying our server was fantastic and our drinks came as quick as we could order them. Atmosphere was pleasant and the staff was great but I know one thing, effectiveness of alcohol. I think if ABC investigated this place they would find they are watering down liquor to the tenth degree! My friends and I pushed the tab until our fifth drink and realized we didn't have the slightest buzz, we mentioned it to our server and started ordering doubles hoping to utilize alcohol for its intended purpose, to no avail. Can't speak to their beer or wine but will say they are watering down their liquor 100%, so evident it's not even funny. Seriously Ed's what the hell I remember you being a decent destination? By the way Comet around the corner know how to fix an actual drink, don't waste your time with Mormon cocktails at 1.00% abv,and don't make the same mistake I did paying $50 for a few sprites they said had alcohol.

abx6NhmaXg_S_JJIpW-pQg.text: Love this spot as long as you come before 11pm as their full menu is on point. The staff is friendly and attentive.  Just wished they would have not run out of a couple of menu items, but the suggestions were outstanding.  We will definitely visit often.

photos.caption: Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

abdj5IX_rDg_8ZD-n9u9FA.text: I had the pleasure of hosting my CD release party at Ed's this week. I definitely made the right choice by selecting Ed's over a number of other Charlotte venues I considered. From start to finish I had a very good experience and many of the folks attending the concert commented about the good service. All the staff were helpful, friendly and efficient. Ed's has a lot of space inside with many TVs and the expansive deck out back is a great place to relax outside.  Ed's is a comfortable, fun place. I definitely recommend that you visit soon.

JB_I0g6-5sVP-nPrIdjo4Q.text: We came out with a couple of friends this Sunday to check out the patio party around 4:45p. Boy, was it packed. Went inside for to ask about specials, $5 mimosas and bloody marys plus some beer specials. I ended up sticking with the bloody marys, so flavorful and spicy! Love it! What a good buy for $5, will be ordering this when I come back. They could have had a better table arrangement to fit more tables and chairs for the growing crowd, but we managed to score a small table after no more than 10 minutes of waiting. The table still had the last person's trash and check which we thought ok, no problem, the server will pick it up. But, we didn't get acknowledged for 15 minutes, not even a look or glance. The trash just sat there, till we actively flagged someone down. And even then, she clearly did not want to be there/talk to us. Our server was nice but, not very attentive. Understandable given the amount of people opting for table service on the patio. Step up the service, I get its packed but if you are going to offer table service, then do it properly, without making the customers feel like a chore. We ordered the pretzel with jalapeno beer cheese and tatchos to share, both were yummy and fairly big. Good bar food.   I would suggest getting here around 6:30-7p if you want to enjoy the patio, the upcoming summer will not be forgiving to those who sun burn easily. Parking is also tough, they have a lot in the back but it gets packed like the patio itself.

photos.caption: Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. The best $5 Bloody Mary you can find!
Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pretzel with jalapeño beer cheese!

LL79GdLfgPe5DO2-Gf2b9Q.text: I've been to Ed's 15+ times, and every time it has gotten worse and worse. The only reason I've kept going back is it is .4 of a mile from my house, and as long as you don't mind waiting 30 minutes to ever get acknowledge as a customer, it's not so bad.  Since the new ownership took over, and name change and re-change, the staff has been not only slower but exponentially more rude as well. Last night we waited over an hour for food, at 8PM on a Sunday, and our waitress never once checked on us. After an hour, half of our food was delivered, and then they were delivering food to other tables before bringing ours out. Once we complained for the third time, the manager came out and flat out lied that our food was being plated (the second time they told us that lie). However I could see him asking the cooks where the food was. He then proceeds to tell us their ticket machine went down. Why didn't our waitress check in ONCE over the hour wait, or have the decency to tell us that?!  To say I'll never go back, even with friends to just grab a beer, is an under statement. Ed's used to be such a bar with great food and great service, I'm not sure what exactly happened!

0TJoyjbjSdI5X8QnSQrsBA.text: Like to play games? Watch sports? Eat? Drink beer? Live music? Trivia? Take honey bun shots? Here's the place to do it all.  My crew ventures here often. Our latest adventure was Saturday afternoon. March Madness on the TVs, 30-some year olds gambling over who's better at the hoop shoot out game. If a read head named Ford challenges you, run. He's automatic at that game. Checkers, skee ball, pool, Kenny Floyd providing the tunes. A good time as always.  We are huge fans of the Sapo frog coin toss game. We'll spend hours playing. Addictive. I've yet to see anyone actually get it in the frog's mouth. TWSS?  What to order: I love the wings and the fish tacos. I don't recommend the cucumber salad. Not the best.   Trivia on Wednesday and Thursday nights. Music on Wednesday, general on Thursday. Get there early to grab a table. I consider myself a somewhat intelligent person. I did not feel that way after a night of general trivia. Live music on Fridays and Saturdays.  Great beer selection. Food and drink specials throughout the week. Ed's even has an app you can download for the latest on that.  Just a short cab ride from uptown and South End, Ed's is a solid spot in the heart of Dilworth.

photos.caption: Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tenders and fries
Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish tacos with a side of Mac n cheese
Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo wings

Ajdw-PuyeX5CmnqTjSRgXA.text: Ugh so disappointed with Eds Tavern. I have been so excited to come here because being from NY I pretty much love anything NY related so it makes me sad that this is a Giants bar and I really have no interest in coming back.   From the moment we walked in I almost felt unwelcome. No one said anything to us. We walked up to the bar and the bartender was extremely rude. She took our order but was not happy about it. After we got out drinks, we were standing, watching the game because there was no room to sit. Waitresses kept walking past us, brushing us every time without saying a word. One time one of them actually hit into one of my friends and made her spill half her drink without even an apology. I was less than pleased to say the least with this experience. We quickly finished our drinks and left.   I unfortunately won't be back to Ed's Tavern any time soon.

1G1ixPPf29n5mXTbw8cu5Q.text: What a great little divey bar to come to and get drinks, lots of entertainment between tvs, games to play, patio area, etc..  Ill be back!

gE4VQJ1jO7m1U1UL04UQKA.text: Wings were good - not as crispy as I would have liked (especially when i asked for extra, extra crispy ;-) but the flavors were good and the specials were great.  $5 mimosas and bloody marys were a nice touch!

photos.caption: Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot wings and blackened parm

keFkQYzjmGCgq7lLJokj_A.text: I went on game day the the place was packed. To bad the staff was rude as shit. This is to bad because I heard this is a NY Giants bar.  This New Yorker isn't happy

MWmQcLvFCIruOI9RpgSmog.text: I've only lived in Charlotte for about 18 months.  Before I even read the reviews on why Ed's doesn't have 4-5 stars I want to voice my opinion.  There's a lot of parking.  There's outdoor seating that's covered and patio that's not covered.  There's indoor seating as well. Something for everyone.  If it's cold out they have heaters, if it's warm they open the back bar to the back deck.  There's a TON of TV's,  There's a few games.  The food is good.  The staff is very busy but still nice.  You aren't going to get one on one service like fine dining.  It's kinda of like you should know your order when the waitress gets there (which I get if you go for game days).  We go mostly for game days but have been once when they had trivia music.  I didn't play, but helped a group behind me.  I think it's well done.  I like that it's not in uptown.  People bring their dogs to back deck.  I probably wouldn't bring my 8 year daughter here, but I see other people bring their kids.  They have games there too which is fun if you are in the mood.  I like it and I give it 5 stars for the bar food, TV's and variety of seating.

mxKHSm2fb25iCJyOGM6iPQ.text: This is an amazing spot in Charlotte that is full of local people. The bartenders are friendly and kind, and make delicious drinks.  The food is great and service is always kind and quick! Would recommend to everyone to come here on a weekend or weekday!

2nuZMH3e0EmmDdJaOLqa6g.text: Positive things first: pretty good chicken sandwich and sweet potato fries.  Easily the worst service I've had in a very long time. Our server was Karina, and between 45 minute spells of ignoring us she answered every question with the worst attitude possible.  I'd give it 2 stars for good atmosphere and decent food, but I'd be hard-pressed to find a reason to go back there when a dozen other places nearby have comparable food and staff that don't treat customers like garbage.

uU4K69v-8VBOt7VPHV4Oiw.text: The only thing longer and more painful than over an hour long wait for our food was the amount of time spent on the can after eating the biscuits and gravy from Ed's Tavern. To make matters worse, everyone's plate came out eventually except mine. It took me asking our server to check on my omelet for her to run back to the kitchen only to come back minutes later saying they had to restart cooking because they burnt the first one. My omelet came out eventually and the meal was very delicious and plentiful, even the hash browns were some of the greatest I've had but I then was disappointed to see my biscuit was very over cooked after all. As for my friends' experience, the portions were tiny and inconsistent. They won't be returning. Very disappointed because I had higher expectations for Ed's.

SsM-dP46mZHKdXaQiwnm5Q.text: Pimento burger was very good   Nachos were decent to good  Wings needed to be crispier but blue cheese was fire   Southwest egg rolls were amazing

BgHKoETMmYOl_8dKvrX4cw.text: Food was pretty good! We had a chicken sandwich and Philly cheesesteak and have noting but good things to say. That being said we had TERRIBLE service. Seriously sat there in 30 minute intervals waiting on our server. I ordered a vodka soda which tasted like straight soda water. I only gave two stars because the food was decent but service was appallingly bad.

ok3V2NQLDyXj9yrqsuO40Q.text: Friends and I went to Ed's on a fairly regular basis with friends and often for trivia. We normally found the wait staff and management to be friendly, until recently. We had never had any issues. Recently, a bartender over charged us and when we pointed it out politely, we were asked to leave. When we came back a few weeks later, tried to explain to a manager what happened, we were asked to leave again for "accusing" a bartender of overcharging, even though several of us could attest to the overcharging. Can't believe they'd turn away good and frequent customers the way they did. Especially after all of the bad press they've had and generally crappy food. Won't be going back and won't recommend anyone else going either.

S6q1kbN2SogCzeypAlUEgw.text: Wings were good. We got Parmesan and bbq wings. Now for the not so good part... when you walk in there is no sign indicating you should seat yourself. I waited 6 minutes before our server greeted our table. After our food came, our waitress decided to sit down at another table and enjoy her phone. She rarely came back to check on us. We had to flag her down to get another beer. Long story short. Good food, lack of attention to customers. If you are into being ignored- ask for Michelle. She will bring your food and never come back.

kjJcLkzT1UBvXiSVhkLi2Q.text: Excellent beer joined. Lemon pepper and blackened Parmesan wings are tangy and have bite, service is up to par and the liquor bar is well stocked

photos.caption: Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

R5UmHvujKwCzjQFiQgfxHw.text: Ed's a great place to go watch the Panthers games.  You can either sit in the restaurant at a table/booth, the bar, or the outside bar and patio.  The outside patio is filled with TVs so you'll be able to catch whatever game you're interested in.  Buckets of beer are around 15 dollars and they kept the drinks coming all day long for our group of 10.  We shared about 6 appetizers between the table and everything was delicious.  The only complaint I have about this place is that parking can be difficult during game day or a big game.  I had to park in the grocery store parking lot but it's not that far away. It is also extremely loud but what do you expect on game day when everyone is there to watch! There is also a pool table available in the front.   Great service and food.  I will be back to watch more Panthers games!

FM5ZqRse9nSxpUPfZxbIiQ.text: IF you:  (1) want to have a few drinks (2) want to watch some sports/TV at the same time (3) want the option of eating some nice, juicy, filling, happily unhealthy, food (4) want to people watch (5) want the option of sitting indoors in a typically loud bar OR outside in a cool open area (6) don't care if you get 5 star service at all times  Ed's is your place. It is exactly what you would expect - and that is why I love it. Unpretentious, fun, consistent...bar. Enjoy.

zpQci5ofdXZqwVsLTyO6iw.text: Not once, but twice we have been completely disappointed or totally ignored when we've tried to visit Ed's Tavern. What a shame too, new to Charlotte & looking for the quintessential neighborhood bar at which we could become regulars. Nope. Both visits were weekend mornings..... The first time we were glared at by the hungover servers from behind sunglasses. They lounged in one of the booths, talking trash about their friends & scaring us out of requesting some help.  When drinks & food were finally ordered/brought....they were practically thrown on the table.  The second time we waited 15 minutes & finally went up to the bar to ask for menus. After reviewing the menus & deciding what we wanted to order, several additional minutes had passed with absolutely no attention from the staff before we finally decided to leave. Keep in mind that plenty of staff were standing around & available to help, they just weren't interested in helping us.  I went to the bar to inform them that we were leaving due to a lack of service & once the staff noticed we were irritated & getting ready to leave, they went back to the kitchen to hide & didn't come out. (I waited for several minutes)  What a shame. Great looking bar, seems like it could be a fun atmosphere, awesome location....worst service we've experienced since we moved her several months ago. We won't be back.

WL_bvhILiJXjI3l-8iaBjg.text: Great choices for breakfast, lunch or dinner. The staff is friendly and helpful . Good beer choices. Some really great weekly specials.   Breakfast for me is western omelette and bacon. I wish you got a little more bacon for the price.  Great sandwiches for lunch. The soup is always tasty.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. February 2017 - kjm
Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. February 2017 - kjm
Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. February 2017 - Kjm

sHani6YtBtQcqCjCMvlCjg.text: Ed's has been a go to spot for Panthers games this year, and all I can say it is a great spot for Sunday football.  Not only do they have plenty of TV's, I love the set up of the tables. Pretty much anywhere you seat, bar, high table or booth you are in a prime spot for seeing a game. And, when I say game it is because they have several on different TV's.  The Bloody's Mary's are a perfect start to the day and on to their large selection of beers, tab, bottle and even can special. I have had a few food items, pimento cheese dip, chicken fingers, wings and some eggrolls. Everything has always been on point and the service has as well. With the new/updated patio coming I am looking forward to more times at Ed's.

BDoMsOGPFEZ8rDirpAsWqQ.text: Food was fantastic and exceeded expectations for a tavern. Had amazing bloody Mary's, delicious and humongous burger with an egg on top. Western omelette was voluptuous and tasty. Highly recommended.

9kRZo5VcX9QFcMBiuINNNw.text: We absolutely love this place. Their burgers are just made to perfection even just the classic and the fries and tots fried just perfect.:)

photos.caption: Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Classic burger and fries

UksTAc8q4LfFcV5_wX8Itw.text: Have been here many times and all have been mediocre to awful. I've had a hard time putting my finger on it and I think it finally came to me after this last visit. Onsite management is absolutely awful.    The waitresses seem to hate working there and are understaffed. No items can be sent back to the kitchen under any circumstance. A plate laid is a plate paid!  The hostess has to also serve as the runner, and she does not have time to check the accuracy of the orders (literally every food item we ordered was missing something or was just wrong).    The GM there should really be ashamed of their performance. Not professional at all.

h-T2Xs6KOgHdSqhwbJ7b4Q.text: I have never had a more awful experience. I have been going to Ed's for over 7 years.  I was in Ed's two weeks ago and the bartender tried to charge me for 3 additional drinks. I disputed it politely and she said she could call the manager. The manager came out and had a conversation with us and kept saying he would show us the video to verify her story To be clear, they refused to pull or show me the video they swore they had. I asked numerous times. The manager ended up removing drinks but was horrible about it all.  I went in today to watch the game and was asked to leave with several friends because the same bartender was working. They lost money and embarrassed customers in the process. I will not be back and I would not recommend others to go back.

Vp4PuYb31XzV5_iBXdooKw.text: Great place beer selection is solid and the tacos are phenomenal. Service was stellar!

zwtltgC3sx56Sd6hlMRGBw.text: Ed's is a great spot to grab a beer and watch the big game. It has a dive bar feel but is very clean and well decorated.I stopped into Ed's during a NFL playoff game and it was packed but they still provided great service. Ed's has a ton of TVs, a very nice outdoor patio, pool tables, and a few arcade games. The prices aren't great but I was impressed by Ed's wings. If there is a popular game on I would get there early, the parking lot fills up quick!

VKAIsRDXmIQjyYJwW09-mg.text: Who wants a local spot with great service.....everyone! There's always great service, food, and fun!   If you're new to town I highly recommend mingling with the locals here. PS If you're at the bar ask for Heather.

6GlJ29mS-Tgv611inTS2eA.text: My absolute favorite neighborhood bar in Charlotte! The staff is amazing and I always have the best service- Heather, love you, you are the best!  Shae, you too!   The food is amazing!  They also have healthy options to choose from, so you don't just have bar food options to pick from.   Atmosphere is great, always a good time!

QLURT8nOVhsjWCOwH5MZzw.text: We came here for a happy hour yesterday since it's one of the few places in the area we haven't been.   It's a pretty standard bar. They have a large variety of beer. There's a lot of local and a lot of non-local too.   The food was fairly standard bar food. I tried some of the fries and zucchini fries. The regular fries were really good. The zucchini fries were kind of mushy. You get half off an appetizer if you check in on Yelp.  I wasn't impressed with the service. I had to ask multiple times to get a water. A waiter or a manger was really pushy about trying to get us to get a mimosa tower (on a Thursday right after work no less). When we wouldn't get one, they asked if we were going to stay long acting like they wanted us to leave.   If it weren't for the service, I would come back, but I was pretty turned off by their service.

juNCOppnIagVT5w8VNBcnw.text: Went on a Friday around 6pm or so.   When we walked in they had no hostess or no sign saying please seat yourself. Stood there for about 2 or 3 mins (with 2 or 3 people working who I know saw us walk in). We were ignored and had to take into our own hands to just sit somewhere and then go find someone to give us menus and assign a waitress to us. Honestly I wanted to walk out.   The place has sports bar vibes, pool tables, tvs, drink specials, and lots of outdoor seating. The menu was your normal bar food burgers, wings, philly cheesesteak etc.    Fried pickles for an appetizer were hot and fresh. Went with the mac and cheese burger and fries. The food came out in about 10 mins or so. It was a good burger nothing spectacular.   Not sure if I would come back maybe if I was trying to watch a game and drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried pickles
Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac and cheese burger
Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

vcHNsA90FpU7-AJ8tR7bPg.text: Me and a group of my friends went here for brunch and the awesome mimosa tower which we got mixed with pineapple and orange juice which was mixed wonderfully, but what really made the experience enjoyable was our waitress Cassie she made sure that we had everything we needed from blue cheese to a side queso for my chicken nachos  and it came in a timely fashion and her personality was great

photos.caption: Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mimosa Tower
Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ed&#39;s tavern menu

g29hfEi2Jmm_A-wa_78IEw.text: Tried to get a seat out on the patio with my husband for a few days in a row and we finally lucked out yesterday. To be honest, we were mostly in it for the outdoor seating to begin with and really didn't have high expectations for the food.  But,  we were pleasantly surprised by the entire experience.   First of all,  the deck is seating is perfect. They have everything you need out there and it's comfortable.  Our server was super nice.  We ordered a bow of chili, blackened chicken salad and blackened chicken wrap for dinner. The wrap came with fries.  Everything was really good. We have no complaints.  We enjoyed the experience and will be back,  likely with some friends to share a table.   The only issue we had was that they were doing construction on the bar by the patio and that was just really annoying/noisy....but hopefully that will be complete soon and will extend the outdoor seating area.

photos.caption: Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dinner with puppy
Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened chicken wrap with dressing on the side and fries

tS3H6niBVzrjzG3kH_auEQ.text: This place has come a long way over the last few years.  Some nice improvements all around.  This bar has a really good "neighborhood bar" vibe to it.  The outside patio is a nice addition, and the staff is really good.  I was in 8/24 for the Miami/Gator football game, and Heather and Chloe were fantastic with a pretty busy bart to tend to. Keep up the good work!

AWxyz9wChPKb7Mn9gbpVsw.text: Wow wow wow! The food is off the charts! Must try the Mac and cheese. It was light, flavorful, cheesy, hot and just delicious! My and I shared chicken nachos and they were really good. They could have used more cheese throughout the layers but it was still amazing in flavor.   I highly recommend stopping here while you're in Charlotte!

LC7AcKKrscY7kFbHaK7VyQ.text: We came for the mimosa towers and conquered! They were 3 L of deliciousness and fun for the whole table! They have two menus, brunch and lunch. My group and I enjoyed both options. The hit were the southwest egg rolls (delicious combo of dipping sauces too!) Other friends enjoyed the eggs and hash-browns (although a little over cooked to one person liking, but were a bit by another person so I guess it just depends on how you like them!), the stuffed French toast (YUM), wings, fried pickles, zucchini fries), and biscuits and gravy.      The biscuits and gravy I was told had an amazing flavor however the were just served cold. Nothing that a quick reheat couldn't have fixed. The flavor was worth the wait though!     Despite the over cooked hash browns and cold B&G, Ed's Tavern customer service could not have been any more accommodating and understanding. The staff was super friendly from the moment we walked in and made sure everything was up to standards if we had a problem with anything served. They even honored 3 check ins of 50% an appetizer for our table as opposed to saying you were only allowed one per table like some restaurants.       We walked out of this restaurant full, smiling, and oh so happy by how we were treated. We can't thank you enough for your services and we will be back. Thank you!

29Z5SPejvibjrRKR7Yb8pA.text: Tots were crispy and flavorful, not too greasy. Really enjoyed my meal and sitting on patio with cold beer. I found it to be better than most bar foods. Good environment. Will be back!

TpOCudo2dpuxKstakczFoA.text: Great place for bar food, drinks and sports. Just make sure to get there early for any big game, as they definitely fill up fast! This used to be my go-to spot on game days but slowly we stopped going because of just that...they were so slow. We would order food at the beginning of the game and get it at halftime. Thankfully, on my most recent trip, this wasn't the case! They were much more efficient (maybe the new ownership). They also have great drink specials including beer buckets and mimosas!

photos.caption: Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southwest egg rolls
Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

4JuVUy2S8yRfeIa4biTTTA.text: Love this place. Bartenders are always friendly and food is really good. Get the tachos!

NBjAQR8rY54oAMSrpsDzwA.text: I really enjoy Ed's Tavern...  evidently it's been around awhile, but it's a friendly, local bar with decent food options.    $1.00 (quarters) a game for pool on two tables.  I love it.  Best.Game.Ever.    Service is a little spotty, but we're just chillin' anyway so no worries.  Off of the main roads, so tho it gets a good crowd, it's still what I consider a "hidden gem".    Plenty of parking if you park in the back and there is a front and back entryway.  Nice-sized deck on the back with TV's and covered seating.

wgxWXeqpf7tGby3iw5vZgQ.text: A solid neighborhood bar with plenty of TVs to watch sports and a great back patio to enjoy drinks on a nice day. My friends and I like to come in on Sundays to watch football, and on Thursday nights to try our hands at trivia. The food for the most part is what you would expect for bar food so it is best to stick to the basics when ordering. I really enjoy their wings and their buffalo chicken dip. The service is always great and the servers are very friendly. Overall if you are looking for a place that can become a regular hang out for you and your friends give this place a try!

BgmCQhpLOkbJGo_d8lMEjQ.text: Solid neighborhood bar! The menu uas been upgraded and is awesome..dare i say 3 dollar tacos. Yasss girl! And bartenders that always remeber your name. It is still a bar with a nitty grttiy sown to earth feel where you can grab a decent drink for cheap. And my basic white girl shows now that they have a 45 dollar mimosa tower!!!

scdpRQ_wWsaqneGkGENWDw.text: Always poppin and lit! Love me some Ed's anytime any day :) the windy hill peach cider makes me smile! The manager also makes me smile :)

fNh8njz2YIwNdQ71uEA4gw.text: Saw an article about their mimosa towers so a group of friends and I thought we'd go check it out of course. At first glance the place seemed steady which is usually a good sign. We decided to sit at the bar and ordered from the brunch menu. There was only one bartender tending to a full bar so things were slow. After waiting close to an hour for food, one order came out 10 minutes later and the proportions weren't ideal. The food was good, but I would not return on a weekend.

9WyTx3POOKq7qfMplY5EGw.text: I tried this place with a couple of friends, one of which was sent there by her job to review their mimosa towers. The towers are impressive to say the least and definitely worth it if you have a big group and are trying to basically have a bottomless brunch/lunch! The actual vibe of Ed's is great- you can sit inside, on their porch, or on their patio. The place has a ton of TVs and is awesome for watching sports and hanging out. The part that isn't the best is their food. I've had their wings and tots before and those are pretty good! A little bit better than your standard bar food. Their brunch food however, is sub par at best, minus their Nutella French toast (that stuff is awesome). I would honestly just order lunch instead of brunch if you are going their to eat around 11 am.

sAWupLOu_ru28ZY4XD97yA.text: Great atmosphere with a late night food menu. My husband and I went to Comet Grill after their kitchen was closed. We were happy to find Ed's Tavern right next door with a limited, but delicious, late night menu. We went for the nachos, they were delicious with white queso covering each chip!

Y2C_K5sJuaXvnUnzrCEUTA.text: The best local bar in South End. The punch will knock your socks off. Can't beat this little joint!

dVM173hZ_ACJue5-yt8oPg.text: Good service, well poured drinks, awesome sweet potato fries. Getting the basics right is hard to find.

AKZVxIlEHvcof0qb-Pgq4A.text: I really enjoyed Ed's Tavern. The manager made sure to accommodate me and my friends who were all vegetarian for a get-together that we had. It was such a fun atmosphere and the waitress, Rachel, was well versed in the menu and quite charming. Thanks Ed's Tavern for a great time!

oQ3U7rJWBNorZmRUtrBokg.text: The atmosphere is nice - the food isn't good. The "chili cheese fries" are nothing more than fries, ground beef, and some shredded cheese. I'm not sure how they call the meat mixture chili. Ordered the garlic Parmesan wings - did not taste any garlic, and there was what looked like shredded Harris Teeter Parmesan cheese sprinkled around the wings. Will go back for beer, but definitely not food.

rlKQo86ubVKY86IiuZF5Bw.text: Great neighborhood hang out! Definitely a locals place and usually packed on evenings and weekends. Decent craft beer selection with a couple dozen on draft and several bottle selections too. Food is also very good but typical bar fare.

cOL-MVj7GIzcoFkf4O7dBw.text: It's a relaxed atmosphere when it's not too crowded.  Johnny Walker, Dewars and Chivas Regal are the only Scotch whisky selections which is unfortunate.  Lots of TV screens for your favorite games.  But I go there because the bartenders are easy going and like to have fun guessing who just played what song on the juke box.    In this neighborhood, unless I'm craving a burger at Big Daddy's, I actually prefer Ed's to anything on East Boulevard because it's low-key.  East Boulevard focuses too much on frills and you can't sit and relax at Big Daddy's because it's always packed.  Rightly so because the food is great and desperately needed along that strip.    But Ed's burgers are still great, the crumbly-around-the-edges kind, and appropriately salted.  Their slightly seasoned fries are addictive.  And Comet Grill is ten paces away if you're vegetarian if you prefer to dine there first and then have drinks at Ed's.  Both Ed's and Comet Grill are adjacent to the Bloom parking lot.

XY9swvNUXze9-_Bd9kvbRg.text: I have come to this bar on multiple occasions and never once have I been impressed with the atmosphere. The food is sub-par and service is absolutely sad for a dive bar in that area. I am usually taken care of by the bartender who as of right now hair is blue. (Alyse maybe?) The area is a high volume area and it sad to see that a bar with such potential continuously is brought down. Don't waste your time or money coming to this place you much better off going to the Comet next door( plus they have live music regularly)

uOMpU3MdQVGs-y95NUQcwA.text: Best bar ever! We come here every time we are in town. Great beers on tap. Lots of IPAs, which I love! Hot bartenders, especially Jodene. And they have pop shot basketball!!! What's not to like...

PWAtdSObNVfoBvyjKFWxhw.text: Perfect watering hole.   Great food and drinks...always a good spot to start, end or spend an evening.

xaFaopB0gqfm_SDG1fkNzw.text: This is where my best friend and I go on Wednesdays. The standing daily drink specials are fantastic ($2.75 for Killian's on draft and good shot specials, too) and the atmosphere is great. The back patio is big, so you can bring a group if you like, but it's just fine for two or three as well. (Plenty of seating, plenty of room to stand.) And the inside is ENORMOUS with decent billiards and a couple of good arcade games. Plus on Wednesdays there's music trivia. (Live music Fridays, too!)  I've never eaten here, so I can't attest to the quality of the food, but the service and drinks are awesome. Highly recommend for any crowd.

eOcALKVWSMolGOE0T0Ho-w.text: Loud, chaotic, disorganized -this is your place.  I've never had such cloyingly sweet sweet potatoes & wings were well cooked but where's the flavor.  The most flavorful item for the wings was the ranch. Service was fast but were more interested in regulars than a new customer.

6-QvVXEmFcN0zuBbS9JYTw.text: A friend took me to this bar recently. The bar has a very chill feel to it-great collection of beers on the tap including local brews..Definitely try the Dunkel & Mexicala..The bartenders are also pretty hot if that helps :)

wOe5J3eKDYr_KPGH8GLErw.text: I went here on a Tuesday night, late in the evening. The place was pretty lively and played some good music, with people belting out their favorite cheesy ballads. I had an order of chicken tenders with fries and honey mustard - all of which were superb and mouth-scaldingly fresh! The chicken tenders were not your typical crusty hunks of batter with a little bit of meat in the middle - they were very meaty with a crispy, light coating that had flavorful seasoning. They also had a pretty solid beer selection, even featuring the elusive Red Oak (which I ordered, filled to the brim of the glass). The waitress was very nice and attentive but not annoying. I also enjoyed their pool tables and a game of giant Jenga! Would recommend for anyone looking to go somewhere laid-back and fun with better-than-average bar food.

30ZsYsbNybj7AT1YB2W3Fg.text: Went to Ed's on Thursday night for general trivia.  Website said it started at 8p, when we got there the boards said 9p, trivia man started at 8:38p.  Food: pretty good bar food.  I had a buffalo chicken wrap and sweet potato fries.  Drinks: excellent beer list with many options on tap.  Atmosphere: big space, good location, pool tables and outdoor areas.  Service: good service, friendly staff.  Trivia: Half the people in the place weren't really playing and rules weren't that strict so I think there were some cheaters texting friends and what not.  If you are a stickler for game-focus and rules then you should probably avoid.

4eovH2M-9kaMUyISNS90JA.text: Tap menu is great, gets super busy 8p-11p. 2 pool tables, trivia weds and thurs. Bar food is average. Clientle is 21-32 year olds. Have always had problems here with jerk guys, but the staff is always good about giving idiots the boot.  Never would choose to go here, but if everyone else wants to go, just rest assured you'll have a great beer!

3ERoIF3JQ2R3_PWLnKQBDw.text: Checked this place out last night for the first time with my gf and some friends. Carly was the bartender and I placed an order of wings and onion rings with her. She brought out the wings but the onion rings hadn't come out so I waited a few minutes thinking they were taking a bit. Eventually I walk up to the bar and ask about them and she proceeds to tell me she never put them in so I was a bit disappointed since I had been craving some onion rings. It wasn't busy! It was a Monday night and I simply ordered two things so not sure how she could have messed that up being it such and easy order! No excuse there. Then I order a gose sour ale beer on tap and she gives it to me in a 10 oz beer glass so I ask what the abv is on it and she says 6%. I'm pretty sure high gravity beers of 7% or higher are served in 10 oz glasses not gose beers. I look up the abv on the beer and it turns out it's only 5%. So not only did I miss out on 6 oz of beer but it was supposed to be $1 off local beers night and that wasn't taken off my check. So I paid almost $6 for 10 oz of beer. I close out my tab and  was nice enough to leaver her a 15% tip which she didn't deserve and go out to finish my beer on the patio and then had the decency to come back in with the 10 oz glass and return it to the bar where I politely mentioned the fact that the beer I had was actually only 5% abv and shouldn't be served in that glass for future reference. She didn't seem too happy and got an attitude with me and told me she had to serve it in that glass. Anyways I walked away and left. Then I get in the car with my buddy and he proceeds to tell me she charged him $35 for a pitcher of red oak beer which he only got 4 beers out of! He was livid but didn't mention anything to her because he had friends with us from out of town and didn't want to make a scene. That's almost $9 a beer. The purpose of pitchers are too save money not get gauged and over charged!!! I couldn't believe it. I wish he would have mentioned it to me because I would have said something for him! Outrageous. I can't believe she had the nerve to actually charge him that. Unbelievable. If you want to get crappy service, get over charged for stuff and then get hit with attitude from their employees then this place is for you! Definitely wouldn't recommend this place and we won't be visiting ever again!!

8Qe32lqGxlqsg3GCwnTKLg.text: Great food and great drink choices. This place used to be one of my favorite bars. It kind of has a divey-sports bar feel (but very clean). The regulars used to be 20-somethings just looking to chill, but the crowd has gotten a lot older and in my opinion, a lot more boring. It is a nice spot to grab a drink and dinner, but it is now more of a 30 and 40-something professional bar. Trivia and Music Trivia are ok, but they take way too long between rounds and it starts really late.

i4SFBfHAw_1DRXPuY26wsQ.text: Great beer prices, great selection, surprisingly good food. Never been there for late night but during the afternoon things are tame, cops are patrons, and we get good service a good experience for a good price. Nothing amazing but reliability and value go a long ways.

ps9wLeDc_2SKBSE26vfllQ.text: I live within walking distance to Ed's and I haven't been there too often; however, I have become a sucker for their wings.  I love their Blackened Parm. wings.  Such a great flavor and their ranch dressing is just yummy!  Whenever I'm craving wings, I head to Ed's!

vf03LtK9OzugakOyoab_Xg.text: Great atmostphere! great bar food! if you get the chicken wings ask for extra wing sauce.

oOsv82Xc2RUTg_78ORqlEg.text: I thoroughly enjoyed stopping by Ed's for a night cap. I enjoyed the atmosphere, they have a pretty good beer selection, the service was friendly & the live music was great. I want to go back to try the trivia & will definitely keep Ed's in mind the next time we're out in the Dilworth/Sedgefield area!

Ln1ZiD4uy_gA0pztegiXbw.text: Five stars for being Ed's again!   The best wings and neighborhood bar in Dilworth.

WoHSXMDFSut0k1fB4q9BmQ.text: I left Charlotte 7 months ago and every weekend I try to find a neighborhood gem that compares to Ed's. Ed's was and is my favorite bar. Coors light always on special made drinking all day at a bar with friends a fun experience that wouldn't empty the savings account. I spent every Panthers away game there. Saturday college football was perfect at Eds. They never let one team hog too many of the TVs. It's what a sports bar should be.   Oh yea the wings were solid too.

L1EtS3RE6R2drrDqLmFPuw.text: Born and raised Eds. Tonight the chips were stale and the buffalo chicken dip was full of blue cheese, which, when described on the menu, consisted of chicken, cream cheese and famous buffalo sauce. I have faith they'll pick back up, but they still need time

a4XeERz29ON7_48LHSrFcA.text: Always a great place to have some late night fun. A wide selection of beers on tap to hydrate before the next round hoops. The place is about due for a new AC unit; the bathrooms probably could double as a sauna. Overall enjoy grabbing a late night snack here and excited to try out the expanded patio once it's done!

WAILNCet_hnhpfzyyqjARQ.text: A real dive bar in the heart of rich people. You might recognize it from homeland. Brody tells mike it's ok to give his wife the business. It has the widest bar I have ever seen it's about 3 feet. Good beer selection with plenty of local nc beers. Good food I like the wings and the backyard burger. The waitstaff is nice and the keep tabs on you which is big for me. We don't come here as much as I would like hopefully that will change!

eJxVAkhrxyoOc3HR5VqktQ.text: I know this is a popular neighborhood stomping ground for some. And honestly I like the low key vibe, just chilling' kinda joints. Drinks here are affordable.  All in all not bad of a hangout.  It can get super loud when a band is playing (they should reconsider having just acoustic live music, or at least not a full drum set as an alternative to going deaf).  So why 1 star?  Well, after witnessing a beat down delivered by an employee against a patron, I honestly don't have anything good to say about this place. (This said event took place before the new year FYI)  After several bad press events last year (including a death), you would think someone would care about the reputation and image of the business.  All I know is while I was standing around near the bar, a loud commotion took place at the middle table (where the checker boards table top are). The door/bar back guy punched the guy who was sitting there in the face so hard, there were blood splattered across almost the length of that long table.  The wife was screaming. The rest of the bar male employees jumped on in and dragged this one guy out to the back. Gosh knows what happened to that man.  Wife was hysterical, and she kept being yelled at by the male employees while she repeatedly said stop beating him he didnt do anything.  WTH just happened?!   Then it gets better.  The guy who did the face punching now storming back in and yelling at everyone on his way, including me and the people I was standing with, for standing around.  He yelled "this is not your f-king living room, get the f out of the way". Hmm... This is a bar, people stand around in a bar.  Am I the delusional one?    So I could only guessed that he punched someone because that someone was in his way, didn't move and might have mouthed back. My thing is, if you don't like dealing with people, especially intoxicated people, don't work at a bar.  There is ZERO reason why any employee should or need to punch anyone.   Management, if you are reading, please don't hire people who have anger management issue. IT IS NOT OKAY, and ganging up on one person isn't okay either.  I go to bars to have fun and enjoy myself.  And I was quite scared and pissed off by that night event.   Maybe they can put up a sign "Come here at your own risk..."

6b-v0zI3i2P3I-2SoW5WxQ.text: Mmmm mmm chicken wings! probably some of the best wings I've ever had; so flavorful, so delicious. Ed's is a good low-key hangout; the perfect place to kill that midweek mundanity (if that's even a word!)  But you know exactly what I mean. On a Wednesday evening, when you're getting out of work, a chilled beer, some wings or a burger, and some music trivia in a friendly, lively environment is just what you need to lift your spirits... and that's exactly what you'll find at Ed's!

v_nnCxJPnIp0VywgqLY8Zw.text: The tvs were way too loud to have a conversation. The food was pretty good. They have appetizer specials on Friday

cylfXW4eI5SoGCsBI_F5OQ.text: May 28, 2016 Very rude waitress who Falsely accused some guy friends we were with of walking out and not paying our tab. There were three of us still sitting at the table.  She didn't bother to ask us about the tab before she ran out the door and chased our friend down the street accusing him of walking out on his tab. The bouncers were also rude and VERY Unprofessional!  Way to go Ed's!!! Maybe you should train your staff to be more professional!!! Have been to Eds multiple times but VERY DISAPPOINTED  in the inappropriate behavior of their staff tonight!!!

atLKi5AFMcqVeRQ5QiV8rQ.text: Ed's Tavern is great; it has friendly staff, a relaxed atmosphere and, since the new chef came in, excellent  food. I'm from Buffalo and their wings are on par with any I've had before. They are in a great location; plenty of parking and an awesome Laundromat/dry cleaner next door. I bring my dry cleaning to The Wash House and then stop over at Ed's for a drink and bite to eat.

GYUNUsElD6cwYvGZi5BUhg.text: I think Ed's is a great neighborhood bar to go watch the game and relax.  The TV's are pretty good for a bar and they usually have some kind of band on the weekends if you like live music.    The beer specials are really good.  I think Coors Light is on tap for $1.50 everyday so you definitely can't beat that.  They also have other premium beers at very reasonable prices.  I have only eaten here a time or two, mostly just go there to hang out with friends and have a few beers.    I did recently have the Spicy Roast Beef Sandwich special for $6 and I have to say it was really good.  Buttery toasted bread, warm roast beef with melted cheese and some kind of spicy sauce that was excellent.  It also came with fresh made potato chips.  I was impressed to say the least!

photos.caption: Photo of Ed's Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

8_bNd2fNYJoSzulDdaTY4w.text: I was hesitant to stop by Ed's because of the lackluster reviews, but I have to respectfully disagree with what I've read.  The staff was very friendly, courteous, and kept my beer mug full. I got the chicken wings and had them "grilled style".  They were quite tasty.  The beer was cold and delicious.  The menu and beer listing aren't going to blow you away, but certainly nothing to complain about.  It definitely is a great place to catch the game as they've got plenty to TVs.

irNdyPBFMhbCcRYjkOM01A.text: If you want to drink a beer and watch a game, this is a good place for you if you're in Dilworth. However, if you're not close to the area and/or are looking to eat, there are far better places to spend your money.   My friend and I went in for a game recently. We sat down at a dirty table (it was busy and someone just left). When our waitress finally appeared we asked her to clean it. She appears moment later and thoughtlessly sprayed both of our phones in plain sight with whatever cleaner they use to wipe down the previous patron's muck. Didn't apologize, just mindlessly went about doing what I assumed she thought was someone else's job. Now, I can completely understand if a place is slammed like this one was and not getting the fastest service, but our waitress spent time hobnobbin' with her other tables like she was working at Hooters. We were there over two hours and I bet she came to the table three times (someone else brought us our food). Hey, that's not enough to give the place a bad review -- there are good and bad apples in any establishment; I'm giving these guys two stars based on the quality of the food alone. It's easy to pour a beer and that seems to be the level of competence they require in the kitchen. On par with a heat-lamp'd McDonalds' burger. Rubbery. Flavorless. Is this even real meat? My buddy got the wings. We both felt a little queasy afterwards. He doesn't care to go back, but I say trust 'em with the beer. They do have a good selection of drafts and those are reasonably priced. The atmosphere's good if you're into the sports bar vibe.

60DzNkG348CiUm2iw5rzWw.text: We drove by this place twice and circled the parking lot on a third drove-by before finally getting the corkage to go in. We heard Ed's Tavern had the best wings from a friend who was a precious Charlotte resident. We gave it a try and ARE SO GLAD we did!!! The blackened Parmesan wings, extra crispy were delicious! They had the perfect amount of crisp, were still so moist, and the Parmesan was flavorful. I ordered a mix of the teriyaki wing with garlic and OMG were they good! The ranch and blue cheese are made in house and are unbelievable. We will DEFINITELY be coming back!!!

bGNGbZGVLd5wWQcR9r8k7Q.text: I really hate to give Ed's 1 star but it honestly lost its ways. For 10+ years i have been going there and they have been great. It is my understanding that a new ownership group that came in and they have been doing a lot of work to build it but they made a major mistake. Who ever thought it would be a good idea to mess with the Wings should be fired. This week was the 3rd time in a row that they have come out soggy and just your typical chicken wing. The hot wings are no longer hot and the crispy finish is no where to be found.  I have friends who come to town and immediately want to stop by. I can get past the lame change over to try and become a burbon bar(odd?) and the increase in drink prices but come on, the wings made this place and until they bring back the old wings it is time to look elsewhere. sorry Eds, you have been my go to for a long time, hope you come back

s3SV4az1r3bJ1WPoV5uWoA.text: Been there several times for drinks and food.  Consistently good service, and a fun crowd.  Feels like there is always something going on, and a good choice for late night food as well - although the late night menu is limited.  If there is any down side, I think the wings are not a great choice - they tasted great, but they are very small and mostly bones.  Overall, multiple good experiences at different times and different days -  worth a visit, for sure.

typGcUqKZ7DNMwKFVmLTjw.text: Really really not good.  Eds used to have the best chicken wings in town and they've totally changed their product. Last couple times we've come the wings are anemic and almost inedible. Staff is polite but doesn't know much about foodservice.  It's a bar.

GtiWpS-qiO2qVSx0gYpBMg.text: I really like Ed's.  They have great bar food and awesome drink specials.  I love being able to sit in a booth and relax or if I am in a social mood grab one of the high top tables. They have pool tables and often have live music.  When they do its always been great!

bhoRlbIQ2G2Va3TaTuCemg.text: For what it advertises, Ed's delivers. Good drink deals, solid bar food, and some decent bar games. The Waitress was great and very attentive, going as far as bringing my beer outside. The bar could use a few more TVs, a shuffle board table, but all in all its a solid neighborhood spot.

kvd7YrHmoUBfiOWnMl4BVg.text: I love Ed's! It's one of my favorite places in Charlotte. Good times and great friends. It's a local neighborhood bar where everyone knows your name. I feel like its a hidden Gem of Charlotte. It's tucked away off of Park Road and Ideal Way in the Sedgefield community. Great indoor/outdoor seating as well as amazing drink specials. One my favorite things about Ed's is the Skiball amachine! SKIBALL FOR FIREBALL!
